Html:
Sorry for such a basic question, but here we go.  I'm new to Prism.  We have created a shell project and some modules that work fine.  I learn well by stepping through code to see what is going on.  The problem I run into is that anytime it gets to a call into Prism I get the "No Source Available" tab in Visual Studio.  Is there a way to have that not happen?  Or, is there a better way to Debug apps using Prism?

Thanks for any help.

Hi,

You could try adding Prism Library Source Projects to your Solutions, to do this, right-click the solution, point to Add, and then click Existing project, then select the Prism Library projects. Also after this your projects using the Prism library should reference these projects.

You will find more information in the Prism documentation at MSDN:

  • Adding Prism Library Source Projects to Solutions

I hope you find this useful

Agustin Adami
http://blogs.southworks.net/aadamiï»¿

Thanks for the suggestion... I think I like the idea of using the assemblies for now.

So my next question is the following... Does this not bother anyone else?  Do you get these tabs alot or are you smart enough to debug around them?  Would like to know what others are doing here.

Thank you.
